head.title: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

hedline.hl1: Credit Offerings Planned During the Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.00 percent and a six-month bill was 5.92 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.00 percent and a six-month bill was 5.92 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Agrium Inc., $200 million of debentures, Baa2/BBB/---. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Allete, $300 million of floating rate of senior notes due 2003, Baa2/BBB/---. ABN AMRO Securities.
Interpublic Group, $500 million of debt securities, A3/A/---. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist and Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
MGIC Investment Corp., $200 million of senior notes, A1/A+/---. BancAmerica Securities.
Nordstrom Inc., $250 to $350 million of senior notes, A2/A/---. BancAmerica Securities.
Unilever, $7 billion global bond offering, A1/A+/---. Goldman, Sachs & Co.; J. P. Morgan Securities and UBS Securities.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT MONDAY
King County, $124.6 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TUESDAY California, $998 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY Long Beach Harbor, Calif.,, $275 million of revenue bonds. Competitive. New Jersey Trust, $103 million of debt securities. Competitive.
New Jersey Environment Infrastructure, $90.2 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY Mesa Utility System, Ariz., $69.2 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Florida Housing Finance Corp., $90 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Massachusets Water Pollution, $344.4 million of debt securities for abatement trust pool program. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Missouri Health St. Anthony Medical Center, $90 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Nassau Interim Finance Authority, $260 million of sales tax bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
New York City Transitional Finance Authority, $450 million of debt securities. Lehman Brothers.
Ohio Power Facility Commission, $150 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Santa Luz Community Facility District, Calif.,$62 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Virginia Resource Authority, $103 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
